Talon:
Talon shook in fear "Dont tell him that I'm here... dont do it... i =
can set Lord Perseus in danger... i owe him too much... I cant pay him in t=
his way... Please dont ask me to do it"


From: Sandy 
Sent: Tuesday, April=
 06, 2010 10:28 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: The Old Maximal=
 Base/Unicron's come back


  
OOC: I wrote a post, but I dont' know if it =
went through, if it does come through, just delete the most recent one if i=
t does.

BIC:

Tucson smiles and continues to hold Talon's hand. It was wha=
t he hoped to hear. Deep down he was hoping that somewhere along the line s=
omeone like Nightstrike could turn over a new leaf. She was proof of it.

"=
 Talon, I'm actually happy you told me this. It actually assures me that my=
 intentions aren't as crazy as I thought they may seem. Remember when we we=
re fighting Nightstrike? How skilled he appeared to be? He gave us a run fo=
r our money, mainly me, but there was sheer talent in his approach, sheer t=
alent that would not have been at all recognized if I hadn't encountered hi=
m. I don't think Unicron would have ever appreciated him for that, instead,=
 he uses him as a puppet to do his dirty work, not at all giving him recogn=
ition for his efforts. And what does he do when they fail? Disposes of them=
. But what if someone else, who he thought was an enemy, actually turned ou=
t to be a friend? You've proven that it can happen, see? It doesn't change =
how I feel about you. So, this time, I'd like to try a different approach w=
ith Nightstrike. I'd like you to be with me as well as Depthcharge and the =
others, because I want them to see the same thing. If we show compassion to=
 those who are otherwise cast asside, because they aren't good enough, we c=
an make friends out of enemies. Okay, let's go see if this works. It might =
not."

He escorts Talon outside, holding her hand.

"Okay guys, sorry about=
 that.. I had a slow leak in two tires and I had a heck of a time finding s=
pares."

Rat Trap nodds.

"Thought so. Kinda is hard ta find tires for a bi=
g guy like you." 

Tucson now looks to the others as he also transmits to L=
ord Elder.

" First, I'm also transmitting to Lord Elder and Kup, and guys,=
 sorry about earlier, I didn't mean to scare you. Okay, everyone, this is w=
hat I hope to accomplish.. Nightstrike may be a minion, but Unicron doesn't=
 value his minions like we value each other. I doubt he's ever been shown a=
ppreciation for his talents and abilities. And I have a feeling he's been g=
iven false promises. I'd like to try and talk to him, on a neutral basis, b=
ecause even though he doesn't work for Hydras, he may just have some unders=
tanding about Predacon technology that may come in handy if Night Shift isn=
't able to get the information on his end, due to the level of risk he's ta=
king. I don't want him to go over his head on something. If he needs to aba=
ndon the mission, please, inform him that I have nothing against it. In fac=
t, I hope he realizes when it does become too dangerous to pull out. So thi=
s way, if he can't get it, at least I might have a chance to get it on my e=
nd. I'm begining to think that maybe I may have to resort to plan B after a=
ll."

Rat Trap swallows.

" So, Night Shift might not make it?"

Tucson sha=
kes his head.

"I highly doubt it. It was a very risky proposition and I do=
n't know why I even let him do it."

Rat Trap salutes Tucson Prime.

" Tucs=
on Prime, I hereby volunteer my little rat aft ta a call of dangerous rescu=
e duty. If I got ya outa there before I can do it for Night Shift."

Tucson=
 looks to him.

"I can't ask you to do that Rat Trap. You almost lost your =
life back there, I can't have that hang over my head, absolutely not. We'll=
 see how it plays out. He may be able to get out of there, but if he puts i=
n a distress call, I'll assemble a rescue team for the job. All right, let'=
s do this. Lord Elder, Kup, I will inform you of my status after I've conve=
rsed with Nightstrike. Tucson Prime out."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <=
airly2002@...> wrote:
>
> Talon::
> 
> Talon smiled and added while her smi=
le turned a bittter one"Then the true must be told, cause you deserve it an=
d I love you... My true name isnt Talon... it was Blacknightmare I was once=
 together mi sister, a Minion... A servant of Unicron... Lord Perseus and K=
enzo is awared of my true identity, and they provided me a sactuary and a n=
ew life; Now Tucson,do you still love me or do you hate me with all your he=
art? do you want to know how I finish in Maximal Side?"
> 
> 
> From: Sandy=
 
> Sent: Monday, April 05, 2010 9:43 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Su=
bject: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Unicron's come back
> 
> 
> 
> Tucson quick=
ly realizes that his com link was still engaged. He gets a slight startled,=
 but with a very sheepish grin on his face, he tries to answer Lord Elder t=
he best he can.
> 
> "Oh, Lord Elder, Kup, sorry about that.. I'm fine, not=
hing's wrong.. Nothing - at all.. I - I.. Um, well, I - just got a very str=
ong batch of Energon and it kind of threw me off guard.. Caused all sorts o=
f power surges but I assure you I'm no worse for ware. I - was just on my w=
ay to Nightstrike when I ran a little low on fuel, so I was given something=
 here and it had a few side effects... Look, I'm a little tied up right now=
, I'll definitely get back to you when I have more time. Tucson Prime out."=

> 
> This time he manages to disengage the com link.
> 
> "Ohh boy, I sure=
 hope he bought that one. It's not like me to lie but some things are best =
kept to ourselves. And this time, I remember where I left off."
> 
> He had=
 not realized it but Tucson was capable of many emotions, love being one of=
 them.
> 
> Outside the storage area, Rat Trap tries to cover for Tucson an=
d looks over to the area while scratching behind his head.
> 
> "Hmm, Wheel=
s went inta the storage bay. He could've had ta replace a tire or two and i=
s havn' a hard time lookn' for tires that fit his specs. Isn't too easy fin=
dn' wheels for that big guy I bet." 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Pr=
eston Carroll <supercyclonus@> wrote:
> >
> > Who: Lord Elder
> > Location:=
 The Ark's command center
> > 
> > Lord Elder looked over curiously at Kup =
as Tuscon completed his
> > communcation, his face somewhat confused and wo=
rried. "Was it is just
> > me or did Tuscon sound a bit flustered?"
> > 
> =
> Elder does a quick sensor reading, and after a few moments the sensors
> =
> track Tuscon's last radio communication as comming from the area in or
> =
> around the old Maximal base.
> > 
> > It was only then that Lord Elder he=
ard the screeching of tires over
> > the com signal that suddenly cut out.
=
> > 
> > "Lord Perseus, Tuscon, do you require assistance there?" Lord Elde=
r
> > said, obviously misreading the whole situation.
> > 
> > (TAG)
> > 
>=
 > Preston
> >
